description: Performance baselines and regression thresholds for Next.js 16/Turbopack builds
baselineSource: TBD - To be established from first production build

regressionThresholds.description: Configurable tolerance for performance regressions. Values are percentages above baseline that trigger warnings/errors.

bundles.description: Bundle size increases: <10% = pass, 10-25% = warning, >25% = error

lighthouse.description: Lighthouse score decreases: <5 points = pass, 5-10 = warning, >10 = error

webVitals.description: Web Vitals increases: <15% = pass, 15-30% = warning, >30% = error

bundles.description: Next.js build output bundle sizes from production build

firstLoadJS.description: Total JavaScript for initial page load across all routes

sharedChunks.description: Total size of shared chunks across routes

lighthouse.description: Lighthouse CI scores from production build (median of 3 runs per route)

webVitals.description: Core Web Vitals from Vercel Speed Insights (real-user monitoring, 75th percentile). Measured over 7 days post-deployment.

LCP.description: Largest Contentful Paint - Main content load time

INP.description: Interaction to Next Paint - User interaction responsiveness

FCP.description: First Contentful Paint - Initial render time

TTFB.description: Time to First Byte - Server response time

historicalData.description: Future enhancement: Migrate to Vercel Blob or Redis for long-term trend analysis
historicalData.retentionPolicy: 14-day GitHub Actions artifacts (sufficient for trend detection)
historicalData.migrationPlan: Implement Vercel Blob/Redis storage when performance data volume or retention requirements increase

notes: Baselines are established after first production deployment to preview branch
Bundle sizes measured from Next.js build output (.next/build-manifest.json)
Lighthouse scores are median of 3 runs per route to reduce variance
Web Vitals use 75th percentile (p75) to align with Core Web Vitals methodology
Regression thresholds are configurable - adjust based on team velocity and optimization priorities
Historical data retention: 14 days via GitHub Actions artifacts (sufficient for immediate regression detection)
For long-term analysis, consider migrating to Vercel Blob or Redis (future enhancement)
